result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Daniel A Klein was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Scheduling notice
Letter from Tellurian submitted by Attorney Zion

Case recalled at 4:00 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Daniel A Klein in court with Attorney Kim Marie Zion. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zion indicates that Defendant is feeling better and ready to proceed; would be small change to Plea questionnaire as some medication was administered while in the hopital

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Klein to 3 years and 3 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 15 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years, consecutive. This sentence is IMPOSED & STAYED and the Court places the Defendant on probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence forthwith
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--No operation of a motor vehicle without valid DL and Agent approval
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No alcohol to be present in Mr. Klein's home
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To pay a fine of $4000 + costs = $5833
--To pay $56.74 blood testing fee (Lake Mills PD)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

If revoked, The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program

Conditions not of Probation:
--Revocation of drivers license for 27 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for: 27 months
--6 demerit points assessed

Days credit for time already served: 1 day
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 4:19 pm

Defendant Daniel A Klein in court with Attorney Kim Marie Zion. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

case called at 11:14am. 
Defendant Daniel A Klein in court with Attorney Kim M. Zion.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Preliminary hearing on September 16, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 1:15pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Daniel A Klein in court with attorney Beth Svehlek for bond purposes only.  Defendant Daniel A Klein in custody.   ADA Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Address and DOB information verified by the Court. 
Atty. Svehlek notes that the defendant has indicated that it is his intent to retain private counsel. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Constitutional rights are given.
Upon agreement of counsel, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Bail/bond agruments presented by counsel. 

The Court requires a $2,000.00 CASH Bond, with conditions: 
-  Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Upon release, the Defendant to report to the Clerk of Courts Office in Room 115 at 8:15am on the following Monday or Thursday immediately following release, whichever is soonest to establish the time of the SCRAM installation at the soonest available time and date. 
-  No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  No operation of a motor vehicle.
-  No acts or threats of violence.

The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time at the request of the State.  Speedy Preliminary Hearing time limit waived by the defense. 
Rights regarding counsel reviewed by the Court. Constructive waiver warnings given.
Recess 1:46pm

NEXT:   (Notices to be mailed.) 
(1) Preliminary Hearing on 9/16/14 at 11am. Defendant Daniel A Klein in court with attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  Defendant Daniel A Klein in custody.
